      Executing DbCommand [Parameters=[@__request_TaskId_0='1'], CommandType='Text', CommandTimeout='30']
      SELECT s.id, s.created_at, s.deadline, s.description, s.group_id, s.name, s.priority, s.project_id, s.task_flow_node_id, s.xmin, s.id0, s.name0, s.status, s.task_flow_id, s0."TaskId", s0."EmployeeId", s0.id, s0.first_name, s0.last_name, s0.patronymic, s0.role, s0.username, s1."TaskId", s1."EmployeeId", s1.id, s1.first_name, s1.last_name, s1.patronymic, s1.role, s1.username
      FROM (
          SELECT t.id, t.created_at, t.deadline, t.description, t.group_id, t.name, t.priority, t.project_id, t.task_flow_node_id, t.xmin, t0.id AS id0, t0.name AS name0, t0.status, t0.task_flow_id
          FROM task AS t
          INNER JOIN task_flow_node AS t0 ON t.task_flow_node_id = t0.id
          WHERE t.id = @__request_TaskId_0
          LIMIT 1
      ) AS s
      LEFT JOIN (
          SELECT t1."TaskId", t1."EmployeeId", e.id, e.first_name, e.last_name, e.patronymic, e.role, e.username
          FROM task_performer AS t1
          INNER JOIN employee AS e ON t1."EmployeeId" = e.id
      ) AS s0 ON s.id = s0."TaskId"
      LEFT JOIN (
          SELECT t2."TaskId", t2."EmployeeId", e0.id, e0.first_name, e0.last_name, e0.patronymic, e0.role, e0.username
          FROM task_observer AS t2
          INNER JOIN employee AS e0 ON t2."EmployeeId" = e0.id
      ) AS s1 ON s.id = s1."TaskId"
      ORDER BY s.id, s.id0, s0."TaskId", s0."EmployeeId", s0.id, s1."TaskId", s1."EmployeeId"

          FROM task_observer AS t1
          INNER JOIN employee AS e ON t1."EmployeeId" = e.id
      ) AS s0 ON s.id = s0."TaskId"

      WHERE p.id = @__request_ProjectId_0 AND t0.status = 'Start'
